events.message: The customer reported a car accident involving their vehicle hitting a guardrail on May 1st at approximately 8 am.
Claim was reviewed and categorised under 'Auto Accident' due to involvement of the insured vehicle in a collision.
An agent was assigned to the case promptly to facilitate smooth communication and handle the claim processing.
The claimant received an official acknowledgment of the claim submission and was informed of next steps.
Additional documents including police report, photos of vehicle damage, and driver’s statement were requested.
The customer submitted all requested documents including images of the damaged vehicle and official police report.
An investigation team was assigned to review all submitted documents and examine the circumstances of the accident.
Investigation concluded with confirmation that the accident was caused by road conditions and not driver negligence.
A settlement offer was proposed covering repair costs and rental reimbursement for the damaged vehicle.
The claimant expressed satisfaction with the prompt response and fair settlement proposal provided by the insurer.
The claim was formally approved after confirming all documentation and investigation results met approval criteria.
Payment for vehicle repairs and associated costs was issued to the claimant’s designated account successfully.
The claim file was closed after full settlement payment, concluding the auto accident insurance process.
